metadata.name: Intro
metadata.value:
We are OMP, a game changer that optimizes supply chains of the world’s leading companies with our very own smart software and services.  

Are you passionate about adding value to Fortune 500 companies? Are you ready to become part of our global team of supply chain experts?  And do you enjoy developing processes, procedures, and templates?

If the answer is yes, you’d make a great Excellence Consultant at OMP.

metadata.name: Profile
metadata.value:
Strong analytical skills.
Preferably a Master's degree with a specialization in Production Management, Logistics, or similar.
An affinity for IT.
Basic programming skills.
A passion for working in a multinational customer-driven environment.
The capacity to translate industry and solution strategies into processes, procedures, and templates.
Well-organized.
A friendly and open approach to working in a team.
Fluent in English.

metadata.name: Your Future
metadata.value:
At OMP, we’re eager to find your best career fit. Our talent management program supports your personal development and empowers you to build a career in line with your ambitions.

As an excellence consultant you can grow into the roles of (industry) sales engineer, advisory consultant, excellence manager, business development manager, commercial manager, or solution manager or move towards people or project management.

metadata.name: Your Team
metadata.value: As an Excellence Consultant, you’ll join the Industry team, as part of our Customer Solutions organization. The Industry team realizes the targets and strategies set in the industry business plans together with the Commercial and Delivery teams. The Industry team guides and supports the Commercial and Delivery teams with industry-specific expertise, advice, and solutions.

title: Industry Excellence Consultant - Consumer Goods
content:
As an Excellence Consultant, you support your industry excellence manager to develop processes, procedures, and templates to commercialize and deliver our industry solutions successfully. You furnish marketing assets, documentation, and training materials and assist in commercial activities and project audits for your industry.
You are responsible for:

Supporting the commercialization and delivery of our industry solutions to customers.
Providing content and expertise to the Marketing and Communication team.
Providing expertise to customers during and after implementation.
Assisting the organization of the customer councils for your focus industry.
Supporting the commercial team with industry specific expertise.
Making design template documents.
Giving industry trainings and growing our knowledge base.
Assisting in industry project audits.
